name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked as spam and excluded. retardo: What a douche. (reported by madnes, zaratustra, mrn)

name: hannah
text: it's definitely the typefaces on the disc, coupled with the punctuation/capitalisation of the actors' names. that's what does it for me right here. that porn is so cheaply made and that's funny.

name: epicurus
text: Actually, Steve and Andy were annoyed that Ron did not participate much.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Ron's gonna be pissed.

name: closefriend
text: Whimsington Storke has the best case of name-matching-appearance I have ever seen.

name: inordinate
text: If I could chubby that comment thrice, I would.

name: spinynorman
text: I have to wonder if Onstad found these pictures or drew them. I sort of hope he found them. Storke and How to Weep the Weepy Weep Way are so surreal I want them to exist in the natural universe.

name: projectyl
text: So brilliantly calibrated to be uninteresting that it took me three reads to notice that a "Hot Pick" is apparently represented by the handicapped symbol.

name: redsalesperson
text: I'm pretty sure that sticker means it was a hot pick among the handicapped demographic.

name: saurkraus
text: A comment left by saurkraus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, SaulBellow, Siah)

name: saurkraus
text: A comment left by saurkraus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GMM, SaulBellow, Siah)

name: lugosh
text:
Your name is almost ALMOST a palindrome...

So close.

name: em2
text: It's what we like to call a "near" palindrome.

name: ssddr
text: Oh ron when will you learn to carry your weight?

name: zerobot
text: UNRELEASED!

name: closefriend
text: A comment left by closefriend was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by SaulBellow, nutmeg, Tirek)

name: honesttom
text: So nobody in 1979 says, "Wait a second, this is an anachronism!"

name: bixschmix
text: So that nobody makes the gauche mistake of referring to out-of-date equine hostelry information?

name: tekende
text: Whenever I read this strip I always look forward to scrolling down and reading this here comment by honesttom.

name: heyoo
text: The unreleased Pewter House poems are largely regarded as the most natural and interesting ones, since the released versions often are overdone for commercial appeal.

name: henrythecad
text: Ron's role seems a bit downplayed. Maybe he wasn't invited.

name: possums
text:
It does say in the alt-text that Steve and Andy were mad that Ron did not participate much.

And I wonder if they're referring to the Ron in your avatar.

name: cormanosanchez
text: I could so see Pitchfork reviewing an album titled "All for the Love of Belforian Mews"

name: headphones
text: They would give it a 7.7

name: speth
text: pewter is by far the most boring alloy

name: speth
text:
i just spent almost an hour laughing at the Poems from Pewter House* frame during which i occasionally walked away from my computer to cool down only to start laughing again upon reseating

*with Whimsington Storke

name: tekende
text: Why is Great, Great, Great! "double-subtitled? What does that even mean?

name: norsef
text:
Nothing.
It's designed to be as unappealing and unlike porn as possible. Whats a bigger turn off than subtitles?

name: numberkillinger
text: double-subtitles.

name: norsef
text: Exactly!

name: fineoakstructure
text: Not entirely true; there are such things as double subtitles on some prints.  I can't think of any film off hand, but I know I've seen films, say, in Swedish with Russian subtitles (in Cyrillic) and English subtitles, normally below each other, sometimes with one at the top of the screen and one at the bottom.

name: tttt2
text: great solely for "UNRELEASED!" on the released DVD

name: arelladawn
text: Has Onstad been spying at my Netflix queue?

name: desert_donkey
text: double subtitled. might as well cover that thing in pubic hair. ain't nobody touching that.

name: bex
text: I remember this, it was the comic that made me fall in love with achewood. The little Finnish dog got me.

name: dusty
text: These are reminiscent of the covers of those old "educationa"l videos, which are "animated" despite the fact that except for the occasional wipe, none of the "drawings" actually move, and some lady who sounds bored of it herself tells the story of some "character", and the only music is the demo from an 80s model budget keyboard at the very beginning. I was thinking of also putting quotes on "lady" but that would seem to go a bit far, as that women was every bit the example of reserved feminine class.

name: celesticles
text: This is the most quality Mr. Show reference I've ever seen.
